positive.review:
such a fun game and the few players i met were so nice and helpful teaching me everything i need to know to play the game. 10/10 would def recomend if youre looking for a fun co-op game

just found out this game is nearly 15 years old and is still being updated and maintained just very suprised to hear that you dont see many games like that nowadays
Really fun with friends and alone! its good how it is free..

The greatest platformer to ever exist, perhaps the greatest game, game doesnt even encapsulate DDnet, its a lifestyle, a religion and a way of thought, my life was controlled by DDnet for a month, how I ate, how I worked, how I took a shower, all with only DDnet in mind.
all in all Id rather have deepfried my nutsack then played this game for as long as I have with who I did it with, however, once you're in, you are never getting out.
Pretty cool but simple platformer game, Iike it
great fun short game to play with friends. would recommend for some casual banter
Good game, sadly its fully of non-english speakers
Its addictive and gives you a nervous tic, for nerds only

хочешь карты проходи, хочешь играй против игроков.
механик тьма, коммьюнити заебца.

захожу чисто на часик или два в день и ваще кайф
крутая игра всем советую за свою цену одобряю тем более что она бесплатная.

DDNet is the definitive client and platform for playing Teeworlds, a unique 2D cooperative platformer. Teams work together to navigate intricate maps filled with hooks, hammers, and challenging obstacles.

Want to play the hardest cooperative 2D platformer ever? Want to finish no map ever? Want to be in pain for hours and cry, getting nothing in return? Come play DDNet with a large community of other sufferers!
oyunu tam anlayamadim ama yavas yavas ogreniyorum
very fun to play with freind
Awesome platformer to play with friends!!!
first it was wierd but its actually nice
Honestly a really good and goofy game.
Played a bit and it's pretty good
This is a good game!!!!!! Lots of fun here!!!
perfect game to lose ur time from life
the best game to waste time

this will forever be underrated for me
i'm glad it's still being actively maintained, hope for many more to discover this game and atleast try it out for a few hours

such a fun game and the few players i met were so nice and helpful teaching me everything i need to know to play the game. 10/10 would def recomend if youre looking for a fun co-op game

just found out this game is nearly 15 years old and is still being updated and maintained just very suprised to hear that you dont see many games like that nowadays

after 1.8k hours pls guys do some IQ tests before playing this game if u didn't go do a mental issue test :)
i have 2 last braincells fighting for the third place :/

DDNet is a challenging cooperative 2D precision platformer where up to 64 players can team up online. Navigate thousands of custom maps, use a grappling hook, and collect weapons to help your teammates survive. The game emphasizes skill, coordination, and community, with a fully open-source design that allows players to create and share custom maps. Official servers connect players worldwide, letting you compete for global rankings—all for free.

The only game where others HARD-carry you to complete the map, even when you are afk.

Great co-op fun game.
This is the best game to make you break your desk — it’s incredibly addicting.

Silly, chaotic, and way harder than it looks.
You jump in thinking it’s just a cute little platformer… and suddenly you’re sweating over pixel-perfect jumps.
But the movement feels great, the community maps are wild, and pulling off a clean run is insanely satisfying
Really fun with friends and alone! its good how it is free..

The greatest platformer to ever exist, perhaps the greatest game, game doesnt even encapsulate DDnet, its a lifestyle, a religion and a way of thought, my life was controlled by DDnet for a month, how I ate, how I worked, how I took a shower, all with only DDnet in mind.
all in all Id rather have deepfried my nutsack then played this game for as long as I have with who I did it with, however, once you're in, you are never getting out.

DDNet is the definitive client and platform for playing Teeworlds, a unique 2D cooperative platformer. Teams work together to navigate intricate maps filled with hooks, hammers, and challenging obstacles.
A lot of fun to play with friends. I really enjoyed trying out all the different maps and trying to create my own.

Be Spiderman and do teamwork.
Simple, but fun game.
Absoloutely the best game ever. Playing a map and not being able to have any progress 10/six se- ty nine not se- ok just 10/69

A challenging yet rewarding cooperative platformer. Skillful gameplay and tight teamwork are essential for success. Offers a large variety of maps and friendly community, so there's always something new to explore. Prepare to fail... a lot, but don't give up!

negative.review: community's toxic as hell
Juego choto no me sale nada
Tttgjko

This is the best game you shouldn't play.

To keep it short, the game itself is a masterpiece, every mechanic is so satisfying and improving at each skillset the maps have to offer feels extremely rewarding, but everything else outside brings the game down.

Everything else is almost always iffy to say the least, since its a community sustained game, the servers are pretty bad, from my and others experience, there are only a handful servers that are worth playing on across every gamemode, mainly due to only a couple being decently populated and others just being empty (keep in mind this is a co-op game). The other issue is this game is notorious with servers getting ddosed constantly, it has come to a point where community members are not even surprised by this, multiple discord servers have emojis or memes around ddosing. Also if you're on any continent other than Europe, then good luck trying to find someone to play with, the game is mostly played by europeans more specifically german ppl.

Apart from servers being quite bad, the other thing to mention is how the people "running" the game seem to have no clue how to grow the game and expand it's community (or they're just lazy), ever since the steam release in 2020 this game has been slowly dropping in active players, you would think having this kind of a influx of players upon steam release would help you grow the community, but no. Somehow none of the each gamemodes communites have done any major changes or have done anything at all really to make this game more popular which is sad, this game is almost perfect for creative people and sweaty players alike, to refuse to try making any unique content whether it being events or youtube content/streaming just confuses me.

As of writing this I have ~1.5k hours of playtime across different clients including the steam one.
To sum up my experience inside of the game and the community: I don't regret playing this game and meeting people, I regret staying around for too long.

this game sucks fucking ass
this shit should be fucking called little russian kids meetup game
ill fishish this review later i have school
Constant lag spikes. About every 35 seconds I stop mid air and glitch back and forth for ten seconds. Makes the game nearly unplayable.

While I am aware that this game is fully free and I find the gameplay to be very exciting based on personal experience... on a connectivity and functionality standpoint, I find myself barely wanting to recommend this game. It's a really great game, which many people could agree on, but the game should [i]not[/i] start freezing up on me repetitively nor should it give me random lag spikes, when I am playing the game on a fairly good internet connection and 16 gig RAM. It personally makes the experience borderline insufferable.

On a positive note, as mentioned before, the gameplay is very exciting and fun. Skin creation is pretty fun in its own right, especially when it comes to experimenting with the picture and trying to see how far apart the face assets are so that it doesn't seem like they're overlapping or far apart. I do feel that the skin template should have a grid of some sort to make editing the sprites a bit easier.

This does not mean that I'll stop playing the game. I'll still continue playing, since I have a personal record on the tutorial level that I want to beat, and many servers to explore.
Man, i wish there were any easier control with the hook...
It literally blue screens me when i alt tab sometimes
community's toxic as hell
Juego choto no me sale nada
jogo muito ruim

This is the best game you shouldn't play.

To keep it short, the game itself is a masterpiece, every mechanic is so satisfying and improving at each skillset the maps have to offer feels extremely rewarding, but everything else outside brings the game down.

Everything else is almost always iffy to say the least, since its a community sustained game, the servers are pretty bad, from my and others experience, there are only a handful servers that are worth playing on across every gamemode, mainly due to only a couple being decently populated and others just being empty (keep in mind this is a co-op game). The other issue is this game is notorious with servers getting ddosed constantly, it has come to a point where community members are not even surprised by this, multiple discord servers have emojis or memes around ddosing. Also if you're on any continent other than Europe, then good luck trying to find someone to play with, the game is mostly played by europeans more specifically german ppl.

Apart from servers being quite bad, the other thing to mention is how the people "running" the game seem to have no clue how to grow the game and expand it's community (or they're just lazy), ever since the steam release in 2020 this game has been slowly dropping in active players, you would think having this kind of a influx of players upon steam release would help you grow the community, but no. Somehow none of the each gamemodes communites have done any major changes or have done anything at all really to make this game more popular which is sad, this game is almost perfect for creative people and sweaty players alike, to refuse to try making any unique content whether it being events or youtube content/streaming just confuses me.

As of writing this I have ~1.5k hours of playtime across different clients including the steam one.
To sum up my experience inside of the game and the community: I don't regret playing this game and meeting people, I regret staying around for too long.

Constant lag spikes. About every 35 seconds I stop mid air and glitch back and forth for ten seconds. Makes the game nearly unplayable.

While I am aware that this game is fully free and I find the gameplay to be very exciting based on personal experience... on a connectivity and functionality standpoint, I find myself barely wanting to recommend this game. It's a really great game, which many people could agree on, but the game should [i]not[/i] start freezing up on me repetitively nor should it give me random lag spikes, when I am playing the game on a fairly good internet connection and 16 gig RAM. It personally makes the experience borderline insufferable.

On a positive note, as mentioned before, the gameplay is very exciting and fun. Skin creation is pretty fun in its own right, especially when it comes to experimenting with the picture and trying to see how far apart the face assets are so that it doesn't seem like they're overlapping or far apart. I do feel that the skin template should have a grid of some sort to make editing the sprites a bit easier.

This does not mean that I'll stop playing the game. I'll still continue playing, since I have a personal record on the tutorial level that I want to beat, and many servers to explore.
